text_en: Has the person had at least 2 of the following symptoms during the episode(s)? – Loss of consciousness or impaired consciousness – After the convulsion: fatigue, drowsiness, – Stiffness, rigidity sleepiness, confusion, abnormal behaviour, – Bitten or bruised tongue, bodily injury headache, muscle aches, or weakness on one – Incontinence of faeces/urine side of the body Convulsive seizures unlikely Consult a specialist for recurrent episodes Follow-up in 3 months Suspect CONVULSIVE SEIZURES 2 Is there an acute cause? Is there neuroinfection or other possible causes of convulsions? » Check for signs and symptoms: – Fever – Meningeal irritation – Metabolic abnormality – Alcohol or drug – Headache (e.g. stiff neck) (e.g. hypogylcemia/ intoxication or – Confusion – Head injury hyponatremia) withdrawal Suspect EPILEPSY EPILEPSY 59 60 EPI 1 EPILEPSY Assessment IS IT A CHILD 6 MONTHS TO SKIP to STEP 3 » 6 YEARS OLD WITH A FEVER?
